character(len=1000) :: s, s_mod

s_mod = ''

Putting it all together.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Now, let's write the Fortran code step by step. First, read the input string. Then process the string to replace BC with D.

Then compute the count. Then convert count to string, check for A and B.

Now, handling the string lengths properly. Possible code:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: s, s_mod
    integer :: i, j, n, cnt, tmp, len_s_mod
    character(len=20) :: count_str
    logical :: hasA, hasB

    ! Read input
    read(*, '(A)' ) s

    ! Process BC to D
    n = len_trim(s)
    j = 0
    do i = 1, n
        if (i <= n -1 .and. s(i:i) == 'B' .and. s(i+1:i+1) == 'C') then
            j = j + 1
            s_mod(j:j) = 'D'
            i = i + 1
        else
            j = j + 1
            s_mod(j:j) = s(i:i)
        end if
    end do
    s_mod = s_mod(1:j)

    ! Compute cnt and tmp
    cnt = 0
    tmp = 0
    len_s_mod = len_trim(s_mod) do i = 1, len_s_mod
        select case (s_mod(i:i))
            case ('A')
                tmp = tmp + 1
            case ('D')
                cnt = cnt + tmp
            case default
                tmp = 0
        end select
    end do

    ! Convert cnt to string
    write(count_str, '(I0)') cnt
    count_str = adjustl(count_str)

    ! Check for A and B
    hasA = .false. hasB = .false. do i = 1, len_trim(count_str)
        select case (count_str(i:i))
            case ('A') hasA = .true.
            case ('B')
                hasB = .true.
        end select
    end do

    if (hasA .and.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
hasB) then
        print *, 'Yes'
    else
        print *, 'No'
    end if

end program main

Possible code:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: s, s_mod
    integer :: i, j, n, cnt, tmp, len_s_mod
    character(len=20) :: count_str
    logical :: hasA, hasB

    ! Read input
    read(*, '(A)') s

    ! Process BC to D
    n = len_trim(s)
    j = 0
    do i = 1, n
        if (i <= n -1 .and. s(i:i) == 'B' .and. s(i+1:i+1) == 'C') then
            j = j + 1
            s_mod(j:j) = 'D'
            i = i + 1
        else
            j = j + 1
            s_mod(j:j) = s(i:i)
        end if
    end do
    s_mod = s_mod(1:j)

    ! Compute cnt and tmp
    cnt = 0
    tmp = 0
    len_s_mod = len_trim(s_mod)
    do i = 1, len_s_mod
        select case (s_mod(i:i))
            case ('A')
                tmp = tmp + 1
            case ('D')
                cnt = cnt + tmp
            case default
                tmp = 0
        end select
    end do

    ! Convert cnt to string
    write(count_str, '(I0)') cnt
    count_str = adjustl(count_str)

    ! Check for A and B
    hasA = .false.
    hasB = .false.
    do i = 1, len_trim(count_str)
        select case (count_str(i:i))
            case ('A')
                hasA = .true.
            case ('B')
                hasB = .true.
        end select
    end do

    if (hasA .and. hasB) then
        print *, 'Yes'
    else
        print *, 'No'
    end if

end program main
